Select Plausible and Stable Models from Multi-Path AIC Search

Source: R/multipathaic.R
plausible_models.Rd

This function implements *Algorithm 3* of the multi-path AIC procedure. It filters the full model set created by `build_paths()` using two criteria:

  1. AIC Plausibility: Keep all models whose AIC is within \(\Delta\) of the best AIC.

  2. Stability Threshold (optional): If variable stability scores are supplied (from `stability()`), then models whose average stability is below \(\tau\) are removed.

The function also computes variable inclusion probabilities across all remaining plausible models.

plausible_models(forest, pi = NULL, Delta = 2, tau = 0.6, verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

forest

A result object from `build_paths()`, containing `all_models`.

pi

Optional named vector of per-variable stability values (from `stability()$pi`). Default: `NULL`.

Delta

AIC tolerance \(\Delta\) defining the plausible region. Models with AIC ≤ (best AIC + Delta) are kept. Default: `2`.

tau

Minimum average model stability \(\tau\) required to retain a model (if stability scores supplied). Default: `0.6`.

verbose

Logical. If TRUE, prints detailed progress and summaries. Default: TRUE.

Value

A list containing:

plausible_models

Data frame of plausible (and optionally stable) models.

inclusion

Named vector of variable inclusion probabilities.

summary

Data frame combining stability and inclusion probabilities.

Delta

The AIC tolerance used.

tau

The stability threshold used.

best_aic

The best (minimum) AIC observed.

Details

After AIC filtering (Steps 1–3), the function optionally applies a stability filter (Steps 4–5). For each plausible model, the "average stability" is computed as:

$$ \text{avg\_stability}(M) = \frac{1}{|M|} \sum_{v \in M} \pi_v $$

If `pi = NULL`, the stability-based filtering is skipped.

The function also calculates variable inclusion probabilities across all final plausible models (Step 6). Variables appearing in all models are marked with no indicator; those appearing in only a subset are marked with `"(-)"`.

Examples

## Complete pipeline example
set.seed(123)
n <- 120; p <- 6
X <- as.data.frame(matrix(rnorm(n*p), n, p))
names(X) <- paste0("x", 1:p)
beta <- c(2, -1, 0, 0, 1, 0)
y <- as.numeric(as.matrix(X) %*% beta + rnorm(n))

# Algorithm 1: multi-path forward selection
forest <- build_paths(X, y, family = "gaussian", K = 6, verbose = FALSE)

# Algorithm 2: variable stability
stab <- stability(X, y, family = "gaussian", B = 20, verbose = FALSE)

# Algorithm 3: plausible models
plaus <- plausible_models(
  forest = forest,
  pi = stab$pi,
  Delta = 2,
  tau = 0.6,
  verbose = TRUE
)
#> Best AIC = 354.504 
#> Cutoff (Delta = 2 ) = 356.504 
#> Number of plausible models before stability filter: 1 
#> 
#> Applied stability threshold tau = 0.60
#> Models kept after stability filter: 1 (removed 0)
#> 
#> Final plausible stable models: 1 
#> Average model stabilities (first few):
#>        AIC avg_stability
#> 5 354.5036        0.9625
#> 
#> Variable inclusion probabilities:
#>    Variable InclusionProb Stability
#> x1       x1             1      1.00
#> x2       x2             1      1.00
#> x4       x4             1      0.85
#> x5       x5             1      1.00
#> 
#> All plausible models (Delta ≤ 2 ):
#> Model ID 5: AIC = 354.504 | Variables = x1, x2, x4, x5
